Context: Research Paper Abstract

Title: Effects of Intermittent Fasting on Metabolic Markers in Adults with Type 2 Diabetes

Objective: To evaluate the impact of 16:8 intermittent fasting (IF) on HbA1c, fasting glucose, and lipid profiles over 12 weeks.

Methods: Randomized controlled trial with 120 participants (60 IF, 60 control). IF group consumed all calories within 8-hour window. Primary outcomes measured at baseline, 6 weeks, and 12 weeks.

Results: IF group showed significant reductions in HbA1c (-0.8%, p<0.01), fasting glucose (-22 mg/dL, p<0.01), and LDL cholesterol (-15 mg/dL, p<0.05). No significant changes in HDL or triglycerides. Control group showed no significant changes.

Conclusion: 16:8 IF may be an effective dietary intervention for improving glycemic control in T2D patients. Larger studies needed.

Question: What was the reduction in HbA1c and was it statistically significant?
